I hoped you all enjoyed the first episode of #TheCaptain. I am very proud of it. And I also hope people now know that Derek is way more than the persona he created when he played. There is a lot left to cover. Episodes 1 and 2 air this Thursday. See you then.

I have to be brutally honest. This day felt like a figment of my imagination at times. We put so much work, care, fight, and energy into #TheCaptain that you lose sight that it actually enters the world at some point. Now, the film belongs to all of you. Take good care of it.

Oh, you know, it‚Äôs just the poster for my film next to some World Series trophies. Something light. 

There were so many on the table they didn‚Äôt fit in the picture. Lmao. #TheCaptain https://t.co/FrRraz6MSA

I was on the field of Yankee Stadium with Derek Jeter and my guy @THEKIDMERO. We‚Äôre two kids from the Bronx standing in the middle of the new cathedral. I got a ‚ÄúRandy Wilkins‚Äù chant in Yankee Stadium. I will never ever forget that.

I cannot begin to describe how hard we‚Äôve worked on this film. I know the film was landing because people were consistently focused on the screen. They were into it. There is nothing more rewarding than seeing that. People cheered. They cried. It was great.

We screened #TheCaptain last night at Yankee Stadium. It may be the most surreal experience I‚Äôve ever had in my life. That felt like my World Series. It is incredibly humbling to see so many people come out to see a film I made in that building. I am forever grateful.
